162.description: Please complete this form to identify the issues with dogs in your community. When we receive the completed form by

179.description: those with bylaws) to assist with dog control issues, but will not infringe on or replace local authority at any time.

336.description: Note that the Animal Protection Officer and this program have no mandate to directly address nuisance issues related to dogs in

337.description: communities (noise, defecation, limits on number of animals, etc).  The Animal Protection Officer does not enforce existing bylaws of

401.description: Issue or Concern (check all that apply)

402.description: People are concerned about the welfare of dogs owned by specific individuals

403.description: Dogs in community show signs of illness or starvation

434.description: There is no local veterinary care and community would like to have better service

443.description: Dogs in heat and male dogs are fighting over them and endangering people

444.description: Loose wandering dogs in community are fighting with or injuring other pets

445.description: Dogs or puppies are not being cared for and need to be removed to new homes

446.description: Too many puppies in the community, more than there are homes for

447.description: Adult dogs in packs threatening people, aggressive dogs wandering in community
